result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard George Nichols was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard George Nichols is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard George Nichols was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard George Nichols

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley. Richard George Nichols pro se. Case called at 9:55 a.m. ADA McKinley recites agreement. State has complied with victims rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 2 in 15CM216. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reviews rights with defendant to obtain counsel. DE understands and would like continue without counsel. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 Disorderly Conduct  in 15CM216. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CM216. Sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. 20 days to appeal. Crt orders:

- $250.00 fine inclusive of costs. 60 days to pay

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA: Megan Kelly. Richard George Nichols pro se. Case called at 10:53 a.m. ADA Kelly gives an update on the status. Having problems getting in touch with victim. Requesting to set for another hearing and if no word, no restitution will be requested. Court will reset hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 09:15 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: LiddleADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley. Richard George Nichols pro se. Case called at 10:56 a.m. ADA McKinley states that resolution has been made. Defendant needs to pay restitution and repair vehicle. Defendant states he needs to meet up with victim in person. Court can extend PTC for another 30 days. ADA McKinley will request assistance from the Victim Witness Office.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 10:45 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley. Richard George Nichols pro se. Case called at 10:46 a.m. Court reviews rights and benefits with defendant to obtain an attorney. Mr. Nichols would like to continue pro se. ADA McKinley sent an offer to the defendant and no response. Defendant will not accept the agreement and wishes to have a jury trial. Defendant states the agreement was vague and does not want probation or jail time. ADA McKinley states that the offer was for a fine only, plead to Ct 2 and dismiss Ct 1. Restitution needs to be paid in full. Court reviews charges and the DA's proposal. Defendant will now accept the offer from the state.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 10:45 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley.  Richard George Nichols pro se. Case called at 11:30 a.m. Court reviews the defendant's right to obtain an attorney. Defendant states he would like to continue pro se. ADA McKinley states an offer has been extended to the defendant. Mr. Nichols is requesting more time to discuss offer with DA. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2015 at 11:30 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Ronald M.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Francis D. Collins. Richard George Nichols pro se. Case called at 2:58 p.m. Court goes over the rights with the defendant of his right to obtain an attorney. Defendant understands. ADA Collins states the victim is present in courtroom. There is currently a no contact order in effect. Will verify address of defendant and state will send offer to defendant. Address confirmed. Bond continues in form and amount. Victim is asking the court to lift the no contact order on the bond. ADA Collins requesting court to amend bond. Court will amend bond to no abusive contact.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 11:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Richard George Nichols
Current: 2882 20th Avenue, Spring Valley, WI 54767   (Effective: 04-16-2015)
Prior: 2822 20th Avenue, Spring Valley, WI 54767 
per Defendant's bond. eif
Pre-trial conference on June 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Ronald M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: CAR, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Richard George Nichols appeared from jail.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
